page.title: 14Mansion House Dalgety Bay.
page.content: The servants quarters are all that remain of the once very beautiful Donibristle House, the seat of the Earls of Moray, situated near the shore line. Until recently, these wings were used by the Housing Estate Offices and prior to that the Royal Navy. They are now empty. There have been many plans to develop the servants quarters. Barratts, a large house building company, proposed to convert the servants quarters into flats and another interested party, who later withdrew their offer, wished to turn the existing buildings into a private hotel. However, a serious fire in 1984 destroyed half of the remaining buildings and put paid to any hopes of development. It is a curious fact that the two previous houses built on the same site were also destroyed by fire.
